abstract.text: A request to transfer money from the current user’s account to a different user’s account.
Siri phrases that trigger the sending of money to another user
A request to transfer money from the current user’s account to a different user’s account.
The handler interface for transferring money from the current user’s account to a different user’s account.
Your app’s response to a send payment intent.
Initializes the send payment intent object with the specified recipient and payment information.
A note associated with the payment.

inlineContent.text: object when the current user asks to transfer money to another user. A send payment intent object includes the payment amount and the recipient of the payment. Use that information to validate the transaction and transfer the funds.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an
object with the results of sending the money to the specified user.
This intent object represents a financial transaction between two users.
lists additional attributes of this intent object.
Siri Intents, Siri Suggestions, Shortcuts App

When performing a search, Siri automatically asks the user to unlock a currently locked device. You don’t need to explicitly ask to unlock the device. In addition, Siri always prompts the user to confirm the payment before asking your Intents extension to handle the transaction.
Users can ask Siri to send money to another user in a variety of ways.
provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.
45 € à Julie pour le dîner d'hier
per la cena di ieri sera
で昨日の夕食代として鈴木に5,000円払って
untuk menghantar 20 ringgit kepada emak saya
Envie R$8 para João usando o
ส่งเงินให้พ่อ 300 บาทผ่าน
ส่งเงินให้สมชาย 300 บาท
üzerinden yemek için 20 lira transfer et
